summary: This is a court order from Judge J. Nathan addressing Ghislaine Maxwell's complaint about disruptions to her attorney-client video teleconferences. The order states that the government and MDC Legal have resolved the issues and assures that her communications have not been interfered with, recorded, or listened to.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who complained about disruptions to attorney-client video teleconferences.

persons.name: J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order addressing Maxwell's communication issues with her defense counsel.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and issued this order regarding her attorney-client communication issues.

events.title: Maxwell's letter about communication disruptions
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell submitted a letter to the court informing about disruptions of attorney-client video teleconferences.

events.title: Government response to communication issues
events.description: The Government responded to Maxwell's complaint after conferring with MDC Legal, stating the difficulties have been resolved.

events.title: Court order on communication issues
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order finding MDC Legal's assurance sufficient and stating Maxwell is fully able to communicate with her defense counsel.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell experienced disruptions to attorney-client video teleconferences while in custody.
The Government and MDC Legal assured the court that Maxwell's communication difficulties have been resolved.
The court found MDC Legal's assurance that Maxwell's communications were not interfered with, recorded, or listened to sufficient.
Judge Nathan stated Maxwell remains fully able to communicate with her defense counsel and prepare for trial.
The document references case number 20-CR-330 (AJN) in the Southern District of New York.
